entries.transcript: Good morning. I took my trial medication at 8 AM today. Around 10 o'clock, I started feeling some nausea - not terrible, maybe a 4 out of 10. Also had a mild headache that lasted about 30 minutes. Took some ibuprofen for that. Energy levels are pretty good though, been able to work normally.
entries.clinical_summary: Patient reports moderate nausea (4/10) approximately 2 hours post-dose, along with mild headache (resolved with ibuprofen). Medication adherence confirmed. Energy and work capacity remain normal.

entries.transcript: Just took my morning dose. Feeling good today!
entries.clinical_summary: Medication adherence confirmed. Patient reports feeling well with no symptoms.

entries.transcript: Evening check-in. The mild nausea from this morning went away after lunch. No headaches today which is great. Took my evening dose at 7 PM as scheduled.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening dose taken on schedule. Mild morning nausea resolved by midday. No headaches reported.

entries.transcript: Took my medication at 8:15 this morning. Feeling a bit of mild nausea but nothing too bad. Slept well last night.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication taken on time. Patient reports mild nausea and good sleep quality.

entries.transcript: Evening update. Had a pretty good day overall. Some fatigue in the afternoon but that could just be from work. Took my evening medication at 8 PM.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening dose administered. Mild afternoon fatigue noted, possibly work-related rather than medication-related.

entries.transcript: Good morning, took my medication right at 8 AM. No issues to report today. Feeling energized and ready for the day.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication taken on schedule. Patient reports no symptoms and high energy levels.

entries.transcript: Evening dose taken at 6 PM. Had a headache this afternoon, severity about 3 out of 10. It went away after about an hour. Otherwise feeling okay.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening medication administered. Patient experienced mild headache (3/10) in afternoon that self-resolved within one hour.

entries.transcript: Morning check-in. Took the trial medication at 8:10 AM. Had some trouble sleeping last night but nothing major. No other symptoms.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication taken as scheduled. Patient reports mild sleep disturbance but no other symptoms.

entries.transcript: Took my evening dose at 7:45 PM. Feeling great today, no side effects at all. Energy has been good throughout the day.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening medication administered. Patient reports excellent tolerability with no adverse effects and good energy levels.

entries.transcript: Morning update. Took medication at 8:20 AM. Woke up with a very mild headache but it's already going away. Slept pretty well.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication taken on time. Patient reports very mild headache upon waking that is resolving. Good sleep quality maintained.

entries.transcript: Evening dose at 8 PM. Had some nausea around lunchtime today, maybe a 2 out of 10, very mild. Went away after eating. Otherwise fine.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening medication on schedule. Very mild nausea (2/10) at midday that resolved with food intake.

entries.transcript: Good morning, took my medication at 8 AM sharp. Feeling good, no complaints today.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication administered on time. Patient reports no symptoms and baseline good health status.

entries.transcript: Evening check-in. Took medication at 7:30 PM. Had a productive day at work. No side effects to report. Feeling normal.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening dose taken. Patient reports good work productivity and no adverse effects.

entries.transcript: Morning dose taken at 8:25 AM. Running a few minutes late today but got it done. Feeling fine, ready for the weekend.
entries.clinical_summary: Medication taken slightly later than usual but within acceptable window. No symptoms reported.

entries.transcript: Evening medication at 8 PM. Noticed some dizziness earlier this afternoon, lasted maybe 10 minutes. Rating it a 2 out of 10, very minor. All good now.
entries.clinical_summary: Evening dose administered. Patient experienced brief, mild dizziness (2/10) in afternoon lasting 10 minutes, now resolved.
